column2: the node at level 1 is called the root node and the nodes at that has no children are called leaves  For example

column1: Nodes that are children of the same parent are called siblings  For example
For any node there is a single path called the hierarchical path from the root node  The nodes along this path are called that nodes ancestors

column2: any node along a path from that node to leaf is called its descendent
suppose we have to find out the hierarchical path of node 10
column3: then it will be 1 2 6 10 and the ancestors of node 10 are 1

column1: The height of tree is the number of levels on the longest hierarchical path from the root to a leaf  The above tree has a height  4
A tree is said to be balanced if every path from the root node to a leaf has the same length
